DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis: Group cycling classes (Spinning®) will improve pain and functional outcomes in patients with knee osteoarthritis Methods: Patients with symptomatic knee OA will be randomized to active Spinning® classes 2-3 per week or control group for 3 months. Outcomes including gait speed, WOMAC, KOOS, KOS, and VAS pain at rest and after 6 min walk will be performed at baseline and at 12 weeks.
DOC.brief_title: The Effects of Group Cycling (Spinning®) With Knee Osteoarthritis: A Randomized Control Trial
DOC.criteria: symptomatic and radiographic knee OA severe patella femoral knee pain that would make cycling difficult medical condition which would prohibit an exercise program
